newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks end down on lack of big buying.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks end down on lack of big buying.

text.p: Dhaka stocks ended lower on thin trading as institutional investors kept to the sidelines ahead of the weekend, brokers said.
The Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) all-share price index lost 3.44 points or 0.32 percent to 973.13 on turnover of 35.2 million taka. Losers led gainers by 76 to 54.
"The market sentiment was dull because of the absence of institutional investors in the market," said broker Khurshid Alam.
Singer Bangladesh dropped 36 taka to 5,089, Beximco Infusion gained 0.89 to 123.68 and Confidence Cement fell 10 to 474.
